questions.question: What is the primary cultural significance of weaving in Timor-Leste?
choices: It's a recent introduction to the culture

questions.question: What are the vertical threads on a loom called?
What is the traditional woven cloth of Timor-Leste called?
Which of the following is NOT a basic weaving term?
What is the space created between raised and lowered warp threads called?
Which type of loom is traditionally used in Timor-Leste?
What is the tool used to carry the weft thread across the warp called?
What is the most basic weave structure?
What are the horizontal threads woven through the warp called?
Which of the following is NOT a common fiber used in Timorese weaving?
What is the process of setting up the warp threads on a loom called?
Which of the following is a component of a backstrap loom?
What is the finished edge of a woven fabric called?
Which weave structure creates a diagonal pattern?
What is the purpose of a heddle in weaving?
choices: To separate and lift warp threads
To beat the weft into place
questions.answer: To separate and lift warp threads

questions.question: Which type of loom is best suited for beginners and small projects?
What does the 'Kaif Metan' pattern in Timorese textiles represent?
Which of the following is NOT a component of a floor loom?
What is a single pass of weft thread across the warp called?
What is the primary advantage of a backstrap loom?
choices: It can produce very wide fabrics
It allows for complex pattern weaving

questions.question: Which pattern in Timorese weaving symbolizes leadership and authority?
What is the purpose of a reed in weaving?
choices: To hold the weft in place

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common use for tais in Timorese culture?
What does the 'Buna' motif in Timorese textiles represent?
Which of the following is a characteristic of satin weave?
choices: Equal distribution of warp and weft on surface
Diagonal lines on the fabric surface
Long floats of yarn on the fabric surface
questions.answer: Long floats of yarn on the fabric surface

questions.question: What is the primary function of a shuttle in weaving?
choices: To carry the weft thread across the warp
To beat the weft into place
questions.answer: To carry the weft thread across the warp

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common motif in traditional Timorese textiles?
What is the purpose of a warping board in weaving?
choices: To measure and organize warp threads
To beat the weft into place
questions.answer: To measure and organize warp threads

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the cultural role of weaving patterns in Timor-Leste?
What is the primary difference between a boat shuttle and a stick shuttle?
choices: The type of yarn they can hold
The weaving technique they're used for
